etymology.description: 高(高) (gāo, "high") + 麗(麗) (lí, "beautiful") refers to the ancient kingdom of Goryeo, which is the origin of the English name "Korea." The name emphasizes the grandeur and beauty of the kingdom during its existence.
etymology.interpretation: 高麗(高麗) (gāolí) was the name of the Goryeo dynasty, which ruled Korea from 918 to 1392. The term reflects the kingdom's cultural and political significance in the Korean peninsula's history.

examples.chinese: 高麗曾经辉煌(高麗曾經輝煌)。
高麗与中国有深厚的文化交流(高麗與中國有深厚的文化交流)。
examples.pinyin: Gāolí yǔ Zhōngguó yǒu shēnhòu de wénhuà jiāoliú.
examples.english: Korea had profound cultural exchanges with China.

examples.chinese: 学者研究高麗历史(學者研究高麗歷史)，试图揭示古代东亚的变迁(試圖揭示古代東亞的變遷)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě yánjiū Gāolí lìshǐ, shìtú jiēshì gǔdài Dōngyà de biànqiān.
examples.english: Scholars study the history of Korea, attempting to reveal the transformations of ancient East Asia.
